newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq trading cautious ahead of employment data.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq trading cautious ahead of employment data.

text.p: Nasdaq shares slipped for the third straight session as investors showed cautioned ahead of Tuesday's employment cost data, traders said.

The Nasdaq Composite Index dropped 11.02 points or 0.81 percent to close unofficially at 1352.81. The Dow industrials lost 36 points or 0.53 percent to 6660. The long bond lost 20/32 to yield 6.94 percent.
Losers beat gainers 2446 to 1869 on light volume of 530 million shares.
"It was a slow day. People moved with a little hestitation. They're watching bonds, they're waiting for the employment numbers," one trader said.

The closely-watched Employment Cost Index, which is a barometer of how much companies pay for employees, will be released Tuesday morning. Strong numbers could ignite fears of a hike in interest rates.

Networking stocks were among the Nasdaq losers. A sharp selloff in shares of Cascade Communications Corp, caused by growth fears, pressured others in the sector. Cascade lost 2-7/8 to 38-1/2, 3Com Corp lost 4 to 64-3/8 and Ascend Communications Inc lost 3 to 74-3/4.
